Authors:
M E Nuhn, Andy F.S. Taylor, Roy E. Halling, David S.
Hibbett, Manfred Binder
Title: Phylogenetic overview of the Boletineae
Keywords:
Boletineae, Boletaceae, Paxillaceae, systematics, ecology,
taxonomic review
Abstract:
The generic and sub-generic relationships in the
Boletineae (Boletales) were studied using nuc-lsu, tef1 and RPB1. The
Boletineae, with the exclusion of Hydnomerulius pinastri, was strongly
supported and the status of the families Boletaceae and Paxillaceae is
discussed. Members of the genus Boletus are found throughout the
phylogeny, with the majority not closely related to the type species,
Boletus edulis. Many of the traditional, morphologically defined genera
are not supported as monophyletic and additional sampling and taxonomic
revisions are needed. The majority of the Boletineae are confirmed or
putatively ECM, but two putatively mycoparasitic lineages (one lineage
of Buchwaldoboletus lignicola and Chalciporus piperatus and the second
Pseudoboletus parasiticus) are strongly supported.
